page.title: 06EMILY'S DAY IN WILLOUGHBY
page.content: After that, Miss Walters will switch on the radio and we listen to "In the News".I wrote a letter to them about keeping dolphins and whales in swimming pools. I think it's cruel. After I'd written the letter it was dinner break. For dinner we had thin chips , mince with melted cheese and noodles on top with some vegetables and for afters we had caramel tart. Then we'd have our dinner break and probably we would play "Port and Starboard". Next comes assembly and we have a story and a song. Then we get back to work, followed by another playtime at 2.30.p.m. Then we come in, work for a little while and then have a story. The story we're listening to is called "The Fox Busters" by Dick King-Smith but now we've finished it off. After the story it's half past three, time for school to finish.
